\doxysection{sockpp\+::stream\+\_\+socket\+\_\+tmpl\texorpdfstring{$<$}{<} ADDR \texorpdfstring{$>$}{>} Class Template Reference}
\hypertarget{classsockpp_1_1stream__socket__tmpl}{}\label{classsockpp_1_1stream__socket__tmpl}\index{sockpp::stream\_socket\_tmpl$<$ ADDR $>$@{sockpp::stream\_socket\_tmpl$<$ ADDR $>$}}


Template for creating specific stream types (IPv4, IPv6, etc).  




{\ttfamily \#include $<$stream\+\_\+socket.\+h$>$}

\doxysubsection{Detailed Description}
\subsubsection*{template$<$typename ADDR$>$\newline
class sockpp\+::stream\+\_\+socket\+\_\+tmpl$<$ ADDR $>$}
Template for creating specific stream types (IPv4, IPv6, etc). 

This just overrides methods that take a generic address and replace them with the address type for a specific family. This doesn\textquotesingle{}t add any runtime functionality, but has compile-\/time checks that address types aren\textquotesingle{}t accidentally being mixed for an object.

\doxysubsubsection{\texorpdfstring{pair()}{pair()}}
{\footnotesize\ttfamily \label{classsockpp_1_1stream__socket__tmpl_a90f07da45ffe49081a4029a4c4438259} 
template$<$typename ADDR $>$ \\
static \mbox{\hyperlink{classsockpp_1_1result}{result}}$<$ \mbox{\hyperlink{classsockpp_1_1stream__socket__tmpl_adce74f37d0f091c0f6f6a63e8c8897d4}{socket\+\_\+pair}} $>$ \mbox{\hyperlink{classsockpp_1_1stream__socket__tmpl}{sockpp\+::stream\+\_\+socket\+\_\+tmpl}}$<$ ADDR $>$\+::pair (\begin{DoxyParamCaption}\item[{int}]{protocol}{ = {\ttfamily 0}}\end{DoxyParamCaption})\hspace{0.3cm}{\ttfamily [inline]}, {\ttfamily [static]}}



Creates a pair of connected stream sockets. 

Whether this will work at all is highly system and domain dependent. Currently it is only known to work for Unix-\/domain sockets on \texorpdfstring{$\ast$}{*}nix systems.


\begin{DoxyParams}{Parameters}
{\em protocol} & The protocol to be used with the socket. (Normally 0)\\
\hline
\end{DoxyParams}
\begin{DoxyReturn}{Returns}
A pair (std\+::tuple) of stream sockets on success. An error code on failure. 
\end{DoxyReturn}
